oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sitka School
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Schools
African American schools
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sitka School was an African American school in rural Gibson County. It was built in 1942 by the community as a two-room frame building and had electrical wiring. The school was set on acres of land, and the community also donated a playground for the school. It is typical of the types of rural schools available to African Americans in Tennessee during this time period.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Center for Historic Preservation, Middle Tennessee State University
